title: Physical Closeness
description: Explore how physical closeness feels emotionally

questions.text: Physical closeness with my partner feels nourishing.

therapeutic.rationale: Nourishing closeness feeds you emotionally, not just physically. When touch depletes rather than nourishes, something in the dynamic needs attention.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If closeness doesn't feel nourishing for one partner, explore what would help. Sometimes it's about pacing, context, or emotional connection before physical.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared experience of nourishing closeness is a relationship strength that sustains connection.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: When does physical closeness feel most nourishing to you?

questions.text: I sense my partner is emotionally present when we're physically close.

therapeutic.rationale: Emotional presence during physical closeness transforms touch into connection. Without presence, physical contact can feel empty or mechanical.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner doesn't sense presence, explore what presence looks like for them. Eye contact? Attention? Slowing down? The other partner may be present but not showing it.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared sense of emotional presence during closeness deepens your physical connection.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How do you know when your partner is emotionally present during physical closeness?

questions.text: I feel at ease in my body when I'm with my partner.

therapeutic.rationale: Ease in your body reflects safety in the relationship. Tension, self-consciousness, or discomfort signal barriers worth understanding—whether about the relationship, your body, or past experiences.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner doesn't feel ease, approach with curiosity not pressure. Body discomfort often has roots that deserve compassionate exploration.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared bodily ease creates comfort and openness in your physical relationship.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What helps you feel at ease in your body when you're with your partner?

questions.text: Touch between us feels like connection, not just contact.

therapeutic.rationale: Touch that creates connection carries intention and presence. Touch that's just contact—routine, distracted, obligatory—doesn't feed the relationship the same way.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If touch feels like just contact for one partner, explore what would make it feel more connecting. Intention? Timing? The quality of attention?
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared experience of connecting touch strengthens your bond through physical moments.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What's the difference for you between touch that connects and touch that's just contact?

questions.text: I feel our physical closeness brings us emotionally closer.

therapeutic.rationale: Physical closeness ideally strengthens emotional bonds. When it doesn't—or when it creates distance—something in the cycle of physical and emotional connection needs attention.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If physical closeness doesn't bring one partner emotionally closer, explore what's missing. Do they need more emotional connection first? Different kinds of closeness?
therapeutic.whenSame: Mutual experience of physical closeness creating emotional closeness is a powerful positive cycle.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How does physical closeness affect your emotional connection?
